problem_text: In \odot X, WS, VR, and QT are diameters, m \angle WXV = 25 and m \angle VXU = 45. Find the measure of \widehat WRV.
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: X on QT, ∠VXQ, QX ⊥ VX, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV, Arc(VXW), 3.14 = pi, ∠QXW, ∠VXU, ∠WXV, X on SW, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU, ∠TXS, X on RV, ∠RXQ, ∠WXV, ∠UXT, ∠TXW, ∠UXQ, QX ⊥ RX, ∠SXR, ∠QXS, ∠QXV, ∠SXU, ∠WXU

Step 2:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QX ⊥ VX
Conclusions: (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠VXQ, pi / 2 = ∠QXV

Step 3:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(VXW)
Conclusions: ∠VXW = Arc(VXW)

Step 4:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠WXV
Conclusions: ∠WXV = 2 * pi - ∠VXW

Step 5:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : X on SW, X on QT
Conclusions: ∠QXW = ∠TXS, ∠QXS = ∠TXW

Step 6:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : X on SW, X on RV
Conclusions: ∠SXR = ∠WXV

Step 7:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠QXW, ∠WXV, ∠VXQ
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠VXQ + ∠WXV

Step 8:
Theorem: Perpendicular to Right Angle
Premises : QX ⊥ RX
Conclusions: pi / 2 = ∠RXQ

Step 9:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠WXV, ∠TXS, ∠QXW, ∠UXT, ∠RXQ, ∠VXU, ∠SXR
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠RXQ + ∠SXR + ∠TXS + ∠UXT + ∠VXU + ∠WXV

Step 10:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠QXS, ∠RXQ, ∠SXR
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠QXS + ∠RXQ + ∠SXR

Step 11:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠QXV, ∠UXQ, ∠VXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠QXV + ∠UXQ + ∠VXU

Step 12:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠SXU, ∠TXS, ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 13:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠WXU, ∠TXW, ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU

Step 14:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠UXQ, ∠WXU, ∠QXW
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠UXQ + ∠WXU

Step 15:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠WXV = 2 * pi - ∠VXW, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠VXW

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV, ∠SXR = ∠WXV
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR

Step 17:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠QXW = ∠TXS, 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠VXQ + ∠WXV, (3 * pi) / 2 = ∠VXQ, 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS

Step 18:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠QXV + ∠UXQ + ∠VXU, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU, 3.14 = pi, pi / 2 = ∠QXV
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXQ

Step 19:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 20:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU

Step 21:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠UXQ + ∠WXU, ∠QXW = ∠TXS, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠TXS + ∠UXQ + ∠WXU

Step 22:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠RXQ, pi * (45 / 180) = ∠VXU, ∠QXW = ∠TXS, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR, 2 * pi = ∠QXW + ∠RXQ + ∠SXR + ∠TXS + ∠UXT + ∠VXU + ∠WXV, 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠WXV
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (45 / 180) + ∠TXS + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 23:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi / 2 = ∠RXQ, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠SXR, ∠QXS = ∠TXW, 3.14 = pi, 2 * pi = ∠QXS + ∠RXQ + ∠SXR
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + ∠TXW

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT, 2 * pi = ∠SXU + ∠TXS + ∠UXT
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (45 / 180) + ∠TXS + ∠TXS + ∠UXT, 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi
Conclusions: 2 * pi = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (45 / 180) + ∠TXS + ∠TXS + ∠UXT

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + ∠TXW
Conclusions: 2 * pi = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + ∠TXW

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 2 * 3.14 = 2 * pi, 2 * 3.14 = ∠TXS + ∠UXQ + ∠WXU
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠TXS + ∠UXQ + ∠WXU

Step 28:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠TXS + ∠UXQ + ∠WXU, 2 * 3.14 = (3 * pi) / 2 + 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠TXS, 2 * pi = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (25 / 180) + pi * (45 / 180) + ∠TXS + ∠TXS + ∠UXT, 2 * 3.14 = ∠TXW + ∠UXT + ∠WXU, 2 * 3.14 = 3.14 / 2 + 3.14 * (45 / 180) + ∠UXQ, 2 * pi = pi / 2 + pi * (25 / 180) + ∠TXW, pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠VXW
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠VXW

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.85 = ∠VXW, ∠VXW = Arc(VXW)
Conclusions: 5.85 = Arc(VXW)
